p: Wild radish is a globally invasive plant that is a good model system in which to investigate these questions. It is an annual Brassicaceae that has a SSI mating system with complex dominance interactions at the S-locus and is highly outcrossing (Sampson 1964). In the close relative, R. sativus, biparental inbreeding and biparental inbreeding depression occur, and the latter has been shown to reduce reproductive output when population sizes are small (Allee effect; Elam et al. 2007). Both species have been well studied, so there is considerable information known about their life history and invasive success.
